title: Too-Good-To-Be-True Rental

steps.text: Beautiful 2BR apartment in downtown for only $800/month! I'm traveling abroad so I can't show it in person. Many people are interested, so I need first month's rent and security deposit ($1600 total) wired today to hold it for you.

choices.label: Wire the money to secure this great deal
Insist on seeing the property in person first

steps.feedback: Never send money for a rental property you haven't seen in person or verified exists.

debrief: URGENCY + FOOT-IN-DOOR: Rental scams use below-market prices and false urgency ('many interested') to pressure quick decisions. The 'traveling abroad' excuse avoids in-person meetings. Always see properties in person and verify ownership before sending any money.
